content:
• Monday, November 19, 2012
  • SCVL

    More on Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL): Q3 beats on both a per share and revenue basis as total...

    More on Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL): Q3 beats on both a per share and revenue basis as total revenue climbed by 13% Y/Y. Net earnings also rose 17% on improved sales growth and stronger margins. The stock is lower after hours however, as the company cuts guidance below expectations. For the current quarter, it now forecasts per-share earnings of $0.19 to $0.23 on net sales of $215M to $220M. Analysts expected $0.27 per share on $212M, respectively. Shares -6.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 PM
  • MMLP

    Martin Midstream Partners (NASDAQ:MMLP) -4.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 3M common...

    Martin Midstream Partners (NASDAQ:MMLP) -4.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 3M common units under its existing shelf registration statement. MMLP plans to use proceeds to repay debt and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • QIHU

    More on Qihoo: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $93M-$94M, above a consensus of $91.3M. Q3 online...

    More on Qihoo: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $93M-$94M, above a consensus of $91.3M. Q3 online ad sales +66.5% Y/Y, value-added services +110.8%. Monthly active users for PC-based products up 17M Q/Q to 442M, smartphone users up 29M to 149M. Daily clicks on startup page (the subject of some controversy) up 83M to 451M - did Qihoo's search engine help out? Opex doubled Y/Y to $61.9M. QIHU +4.9% AH. CC at 7PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • BOBE

    More on Bob Evans (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ2 misses on all counts on flat overall Y/Y revenue growth....

    More on Bob Evans (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ2 misses on all counts on flat overall Y/Y revenue growth. Net earnings fell 19% on heavy charges and lower sales at its largest namesake restaurants segment. Additionally, chairman and CEO Steve Davis says the company is evaluating strategic alternatives for its Mimi's Cafe chain, which saw sales continue to fall in the latest period. Shares -1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • AEM

    Agnico-Eagle Mines (NYSE:AEM) provides an update of its 2012 exploration programs: Indicated...

    Agnico-Eagle Mines (NYSE:AEM) provides an update of its 2012 exploration programs: Indicated resources at Meliadine's Wesmeg and Normeg zones in Canada increased by ~40% to more than 5.5M metric tons, new positive results at depth are revealed in Rimpi Zone at Kittila in Finland, and progress is seen at La India and Tarachi in Mexico. AEM -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • KKD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KKD +10.8%. OTC:LTRE +7.1%. GLUU +4.3%. QIHU +4.2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KKD +10.8%. OTC:LTRE +7.1%. GLUU +4.3%. QIHU +4.2%. RYL +3.4%.
    After-hours top losers: MNTA -7.7%. MMLP -4.7%. JACK -4.7%. OVTI -4.1%. DELL-OLD -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • KKD

    More on Krispy Kreme (KKD): Q3 beats across the board on an 8% gain in total revenue. Net...

    More on Krispy Kreme (KKD): Q3 beats across the board on an 8% gain in total revenue. Net earnings rose by 6.9% Y/Y on a like gain in same-store sales. The company also boosted its guidance, now expecting its FY13 EPS to be around $0.44 - 0.47, above Street estimates of $0.43. Shares +12.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • RGR

    Sturm, Ruger & Co. (NYSE:RGR) +5.3% AH after declaring a $4.50/share special dividend, which...

    Sturm, Ruger & Co. (NYSE:RGR) +5.3% AH after declaring a $4.50/share special dividend, which will be paid on Dec. 21 to shareholders on record as of Dec. 7. The gun manufacturer's shares have rallied over the last 5 months after falling in the spring. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU): Q3 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $84M (+77% Y/Y) beats by...

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU): Q3 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $84M (+77% Y/Y) beats by $2.5M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q3 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $695.8M beats by $16M....

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q3 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $695.8M beats by $16M. Shares -3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • URBN

    More on Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q3 meets on the top line as total revenue climbed 13%...

    More on Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q3 meets on the top line as total revenue climbed 13% Y/Y, but comes up just shy on a per share basis. Net profit rose 17% on record top-line growth and stronger margins due to fewer markdowns. Comparable retail segment sales, including its catalog and online businesses, grew 8% in the period, including growth of 7% at its namesake brand, 6% at Anthropologie and 24% at Free People. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • JACK

    Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK): FQ4 EPS of $0.27 misses by $0.10. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)

    Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK): FQ4 EPS of $0.27 misses by $0.10. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • AWRE

    Aware (NASDAQ:AWRE) +8.4% AH after declaring a $1.80/share special dividend, which will be paid...

    Aware (NASDAQ:AWRE) +8.4% AH after declaring a $1.80/share special dividend, which will be paid on Dec. 17 to shareholders on record as of Dec. 3. The dividend, which features a payout of $40M, comes 7 months after Aware announced a $1.15/share special dividend in tandem with a $75M patent sale to Intel.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • ARP

    Atlas Resource Partners (NYSE:ARP) agrees to acquire Barnett Shale and Marble Falls assets in...

    Atlas Resource Partners (NYSE:ARP) agrees to acquire Barnett Shale and Marble Falls assets in Texas from DTE Energy (NYSE:DTE) for ~$255M. ARP increases 2013 distribution guidance and expects immediately accretive cash flow from the added oil and natural gas production, which averaged ~3,800 boe/day YTD. To fund the deal, ARP announces a public offering of 6.8M common units. ARP -2.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • MAG

    Shares of MAG Silver (MVG -9.8%) plunged in the final hour of trading on news that Benito...

    Shares of MAG Silver (MVG -9.8%) plunged in the final hour of trading on news that Benito Juarez landholders voted during a local assembly meeting over the weekend to expel the company from its Cinco de Mayo property and establish a 100-year mining moratorium. MAG believes the resolutions are illegal and will not be permitted to stand.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD): Q3 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $107.1M (+8.5% Y/Y)...

    Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD): Q3 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $107.1M (+8.5% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ4 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.03. Revenue of...

    Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ4 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $578.3M (+5% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares -0.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • A

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ4 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.77B (+2% Y/Y)...

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ4 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.77B (+2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q3 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $692.9M (+13.6% Y/Y)...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q3 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $692.9M (+13.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN): FQ4 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $490.1M misses...

    Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN): FQ4 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $490.1M misses by $6M. Shares -2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • PLM

    PolyMet Mining (PLM +7.2%) announces the completion of key milestones in the environmental...

    PolyMet Mining (PLM +7.2%) announces the completion of key milestones in the environmental review of its 100%-owned copper-nickel-precious metals project located in the Mesabi Iron Range mining district in northeastern Minnesota.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • OCLR

    Oclaro (OCLR +19.4%) has become one of the day's big tech winners in the absence of major news...

    Oclaro (OCLR +19.4%) has become one of the day's big tech winners in the absence of major news hitting the wires, and has done so on volume roughly 4x its daily average. Today's rally comes nearly two weeks after shares were crushed by an earnings miss, after which they declined further. Optical component peer Finisar (FNSR +7.4%) is also up strongly, though its volume is below-average.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • RS

    Credit Suisse thinks that U.S. steel sector valuations are already pricing in "fiscal cliff"...

    Credit Suisse thinks that U.S. steel sector valuations are already pricing in "fiscal cliff" uncertainty, and thinks there's a trading opportunity in the sector over the next 3-6 months as demand and pricing improve. The firm reiterates an Outperform on: Reliance Steel (RS +3%), Metals USA (MUSA +0.5%), Nucor (NUE +2.6%), and AK Steel (AKS +2.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • FLO

    Flower Foods (FLO +1.7%) continues to trade higher following news of the demise of Hostess...

    Flower Foods (FLO +1.7%) continues to trade higher following news of the demise of Hostess Brands. The company is a clear winner from the lack of Hostess products on the shelves of grocery stores and outlets even if the shortage is short-lived with reports out P-E firms are sniffing around the Hostess trash bin.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +2.2%) shares are on the move despite negative comments from Jefferies, which...

    AK Steel (AKS +2.2%) shares are on the move despite negative comments from Jefferies, which lowers its AKS price target to $3.50 from $5. Though bankruptcy risk was reduced by its capital raise, AKS remains a shaky investment thanks to continued cost disadvantages relative to peers, challenging conditions in its markets, and risks associated with its greenfield projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • KBR

    The DoJ is suing KBR (KBR +1.7%) and a Kuwaiti subcontractor for false claims on $120M in...

    The DoJ is suing KBR (KBR +1.7%) and a Kuwaiti subcontractor for false claims on $120M in contracts awarded to house American troops in Iraq. In its complaint, the government alleges that KBR agreed to pay a 60% surcharge to First Kuwaiti despite being aware that the company had inflated its crane and truck costs, among other items, and misrepresented the cause of its delays, then knowingly passed the cost on to the government.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • REPYY

    A Spanish court agrees to consider a lawsuit by Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +2.5%) against Chevron (CVX...

    A Spanish court agrees to consider a lawsuit by Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +2.5%) against Chevron (CVX +1.5%) and other companies that invest in YPF (YPF +5.3%) after Argentina seized control of the Spanish firm's majority stake in YPF in April. CVX and YPF announced a deal in September to jointly explore for shale oil and natural gas in Argentina's Vaca Muerta field.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • ERN

    Camac Energy (CAK +20%) shares spike as CEO Kase Lawal adopts a prearranged trading plan in...

    Camac Energy (CAK +20%) shares spike as CEO Kase Lawal adopts a prearranged trading plan in accordance with SEC Rule 10b5-1 which will enable him to purchase up to 2M shares of CAK common stock during the next three months at prevailing market prices and subject to conditions and restrictions relating to volume, price and timing.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • LRN

    K12 (LRN -16.5%) responds to concerns raised by Wells Fargo over the Colorado Virtual Academy,...

    K12 (LRN -16.5%) responds to concerns raised by Wells Fargo over the Colorado Virtual Academy, saying it's working to address performance issues with a special operations team at the site. So far, the company's defense hasn't budged shares much past the 52-week lows they etched out earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2%) says its received European approval for its Portico heart valve...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2%) says its received European approval for its Portico heart valve replacement device. The approval gives STJ access to a burgeoning market for the devices, and the news gives a much-needed lift to the stock after a string of negative headlines in recent months has driven the stock down near 52-week lows. Since October alone, STJ has shaved nearly 17% off its market cap.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -1.2%) declares it's "not in talks to enter into a new search partnership,"...

    Facebook (FB -1.2%) declares it's "not in talks to enter into a new search partnership," quashing speculation that a report from The Telegraph about partnership talks with Yahoo (YHOO +2.2%) suggests a search deal could happen. Mark Zuckerberg has been clear about Facebook's interest in search, but less so about whether he wants to build a full-blown Google rival or just a "social" search platform relying heavily on Facebook's data. Shares are underperforming today after rocketing higher following Wednesday's lockup expiration.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • BP

    BP (BP +2.5%) says an appraisal well off Trinidad and Tobago has found more natural gas at the...

    BP (BP +2.5%) says an appraisal well off Trinidad and Tobago has found more natural gas at the Savonette field, leading the company to double its estimate of resources there to 2T cubic feet. BP, which has a 100% stake in the Savonette-4 well, plans two additional development wells to round out the field's potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +2%) gains today after saying earlier that its oral AKT inhibitor...

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +2%) gains today after saying earlier that its oral AKT inhibitor perifosine, when combined with temsirolimus, was well tolerated while treating recurrent or progressive malignant glioma during Phase 1 clinical trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • ZLTQ

    Medical technology company Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ +3.5%) gains after naming Patrick F. Williams...

    Medical technology company Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ +3.5%) gains after naming Patrick F. Williams as CFO, effective immediately. Mr. Williams' comes to the position with solid credentials, with experience in strategic planning, operational management, financial reporting and investor relations in the medical technology industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +4.5%) gains on its announcement earlier today that a CHMP Day 180...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +4.5%) gains on its announcement earlier today that a CHMP Day 180 Second List of Outstanding Issues from the European Medicines Agency found no objections regarding its Marketing Authorization Application for its schizophrenia treatment Adasuve. There were two major objections outlined in the CHMP's initial release, which appear to have been resolved. ALXA expects to receive its Day 210 EMA Opinion in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +6.1%) outperforms after hosting a conference call to address what it called the...

    3D Systems (DDD +6.1%) outperforms after hosting a conference call to address what it called the "materially inaccurate and misleading conclusions" of recent articles about the company. SA's Gray Wolf Research and Douglas W. House had recently taken aim at 3D's accounting and acquisition-fueled growth. Shares still remain well below where they traded prior to last Monday's decline. SSYS +4.8%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 3 Comments
  • NTR

    "Agrium's shareholders have overwhelmingly rejected Jana's ideas" and a "breakup of Agrium will...

    "Agrium's shareholders have overwhelmingly rejected Jana's ideas" and a "breakup of Agrium will destroy value rather than create it," Agrium (AGU +3.4%) management says in response to Jana Partners' plan to run its own slate of nominees for election to AGU's board. Shareholders "invest in Agrium in part because they want exposure to retail and the advantages of our integrated model."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • CRUS

    If Apple makes a big move, there's a good chance these days Cirrus Logic (CRUS +9.7%) will make...

    If Apple makes a big move, there's a good chance these days Cirrus Logic (CRUS +9.7%) will make an even bigger one. Cirrus shares are getting a much-needed relief rally today as Apple bounces in the wake of positive sell-side commentary. OmniVision (OVTI +5.3%) and Skyworks (SWKS +4.6%), two other key Apple suppliers, are also up strongly. Cirrus, believed to get over 3/4 of its sales from Apple, had tumbled in November due to Apple and margin-related concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • BMTI

    Midday top 10 gainers: BMTI +72%. SAB-OLD +65%. GTIM +48%. TRT +19%. OCLR +14%. ASUR +13%. LGND...

    Midday top 10 gainers: BMTI +72%. SAB-OLD +65%. GTIM +48%. TRT +19%. OCLR +14%. ASUR +13%. LGND +13%. BGCP +13%. CEDC +12%. MHR +12%. Midday top 10 Losers: SGOC -14%. OTC:BSPM -12%. TSTC -12%. LRN -12%. OTCPK:ALDA -11%. DMND -12%. MLP -10%. ACTG -10%. MSB -10%. NOAH -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • BGCP

    BGC Partners (BGCP +13.8%) surges, helped by upgrade to Strong Buy at Raymond James, with...

    BGC Partners (BGCP +13.8%) surges, helped by upgrade to Strong Buy at Raymond James, with analyst Pat O'Shaughnessy saying a 29% November decline (following weak earnings) isn't warranted. The firm, he says, should have no trouble paying its now-reduced dividend, and any impairment to operations from Sandy is temporary.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • SAP

    SAP (SAP +2.9%) is closing on its 52-week high after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from...

    SAP (SAP +2.9%) is closing on its 52-week high after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from William Blair. The firm argues SAP is benefiting from acquisitions, new innovations, end-to-end product suites, and strong demand for its Hana in-memory database. SAP's sales growth has easily outpaced that of archrival Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) in recent quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +9.1%) soars on an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan, which argues the memory IP...

    Rambus (RMBS +9.1%) soars on an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan, which argues the memory IP firm's shares have suffered enough this year, and that downside is limited by Rambus' cash and contract revenue. It also thinks a settlement with SK Hynix could act as a positive catalyst - Rambus received a mixed verdict in an age-old suit against the DRAM maker in September. JPMorgan downgraded Rambus in June, when shares were over 20% higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships (DCIX +10.1%) trades higher today after the company reported Q3 earnings...

    Diana Containerships (DCIX +10.1%) trades higher today after the company reported Q3 earnings that were in line with EPS consensus estimates, but came in slightly higher on its top line. Total sales jumped by 50% Y/Y, largely driven by solid numbers out of its time charter unit, plus the addition to its fleet of of new vessels. The company currently operates 10 vessels, as compared to just 2 at the end of 2010.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • VICR

    Vicor Corp. (VICR +6.8%) trades up today on the back of the company's announcment that it's...

    Vicor Corp. (VICR +6.8%) trades up today on the back of the company's announcment that it's commencing a "Dutch Auction" tender offer to repurchase shares up to $20M shares of its common stock. The tender is expected to commence Monday, November 26, and to expire, unless extended, by Friday, December 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • SNP

    Sinopec (SNP +1.6%) says it will gain 100M barrels of recoverable resources from the $2.5B...

    Sinopec (SNP +1.6%) says it will gain 100M barrels of recoverable resources from the $2.5B purchase of Total's (TOT +3%) 20% stake and operating rights in offshore block OML 138 in the Usan field in the Niger Delta basin. The deal is part of SNP's plans to more than double its share of oil output from overseas projects to more than 50M metric tons/year by 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.7%) outperforms following news Dish Network (DISH -2.1%) offered...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.7%) outperforms following news Dish Network (DISH -2.1%) offered $11/share for MetroPCS (PCS +1.2%) before the latter decided to merge with T-Mobile USA. With MetroPCS off the table in the absence of a higher bid, Dish could conceivably turn to Leap to further its 4G ambitions. Dish is underperforming: aside from the MetroPCS disclosure, investors may be bothered by the WSJ's claim that FCC officials are "leaning" toward limiting the use of Dish's 4G spectrum out of interference concerns. (Dish/Google)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +4.3%) gains after announcing a project utilizing a stationary fuel cell...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +4.3%) gains after announcing a project utilizing a stationary fuel cell power plant to support Microsoft's (MSFT +0.7%) latest data center research project. The power plant will utilize renewable biogas generated by a wastewater treatment facility to generate ultra-clean and carbon-neutral electricity to power MSFT's Data Plant project in Cheyenne, Wyoming. The project could be groundbreaking for FCEL to demonstrate the effectiveness of using it's biogas technology as an efficient source of sustainable power.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +4.8%) is roaring higher after analysts came to its defense yet again (I, II)....

    Apple (AAPL +4.8%) is roaring higher after analysts came to its defense yet again (I, II). Today's gains come as the Beijing Times reports China Telecom (NYSE:CHA) will begin taking iPhone 5 pre-orders tomorrow, and 9to5 Mac reports early builds of the next version of Mac OS X feature Siri and Maps integration.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 12 Comments
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE +2.4%) receives a key license to expand its Carajas railroad, linking the world's...

    Vale (VALE +2.4%) receives a key license to expand its Carajas railroad, linking the world's biggest iron ore mine with a major port in northern Brazil. The license removes one of several major regulatory hurdles to Vale's $19B project to develop the Serra Sul mine at Carajas in the Brazilian Amazon.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +3.7%) says it has spudded an exploration well at the prolific...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +3.7%) says it has spudded an exploration well at the prolific Dussafu Marin concession off Gabon in west Africa. Saipem’s Scarabeo 3 semi-submersible has begun drilling in water depths of 380 feet on the Dussafu Tortue Marin 1 probe on the way to a planned total depth of ~10,500 feet.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • UTSI

    UT Starcom (UTSI +13.9%) rallies to $0.90 after announcing a 3-for-1 reverse split, and a $30M...

    UT Starcom (UTSI +13.9%) rallies to $0.90 after announcing a 3-for-1 reverse split, and a $30M tender offer for outstanding shares at a price of $1.20. The Chinese telecom equipment company reported a 19% Y/Y revenue drop for Q3 last week, and announced a CFO change in October.  (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • LGND

    Shares of Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +13.9%) are soaring since being removed from a a trading...

    Shares of Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +13.9%) are soaring since being removed from a a trading halt earlier this morning. The stock was halted after its partner GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +1%) announced the FDA has approved Promacta for the treatment of thrombocytopenia - a condition in patients with chronic hepatitis C that causes low blood platelet counts - which will allow them to initiate and maintain interferon-based therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • GRPN

    A smart gambit or a sign of desperation? Groupon (GRPN +5%) has opened a 4K square foot "concept...

    A smart gambit or a sign of desperation? Groupon (GRPN +5%) has opened a 4K square foot "concept store" in Hong Kong it says will allow visitors to "experience the Groupon lifestyle" and pick up products purchased on Groupon's site. Flash mob dancers have been scattered around Hong Kong to help spread the news, which comes as Groupon increasingly depends on regular e-commerce sales (both its own and those of third parties) to make up for daily deals weakness. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • INVE

    Identive Group (INVE +17%) advances after being selected by the Department of Homeland Security...

    Identive Group (INVE +17%) advances after being selected by the Department of Homeland Security to implement its Hirsch-brand access control and security management systems at more than 200 agency locations nationwide. INVE's systems will secure entry and exit points at the agency's facilities using a array of access control, video surveillance, intrusion detection, building detection and other network-based systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • SFD

    Chicken sellers Smithfield Foods (SFD +3.1%), Sanderson Farms (SAFM +2%), and Pilgrim's Pride...

    Chicken sellers Smithfield Foods (SFD +3.1%), Sanderson Farms (SAFM +2%), and Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +1%) move higher after Tyson Foods (TSN +7.5%) shows strong profits in its chicken business. Looking forward, Tyson expects its chicken segment to remain profitable in 2013 despite the challenge of higher grain costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy (TLM +2.1%) says it found a “significant accumulation" of light oil at a...

    Talisman Energy (TLM +2.1%) says it found a “significant accumulation" of light oil at a well in Kurdistan which could produce as much as 3,450 barrels of oil and 8.8M cubic feet of natural gas a day. The oil column is at least 146 meters in the Oligocene reservoir, and TLM plans another well to test the extent of the oil column.
